triples.name: Unmanned surface vehicle
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on coordinated control of autonomous surface vehicles, which are marine vessels operating without crew in cluttered ocean environments.

triples.name: Motion control
triples.relevance: Motion control is central to coordinating vehicle movements and is a key challenge addressed in the paper's overview.

triples.name: Collision avoidance system
triples.relevance: The paper emphasizes collision avoidance as a critical requirement for fleet formation control with multiple ASVs.

triples.name: Autonomous underwater vehicle
triples.relevance: Discussed as a related autonomous vehicle system in the final section on future research directions alongside ASVs.

triples.name: Trajectory optimization
triples.relevance: Trajectory-guided coordinated control of multiple ASVs is one of the main research areas reviewed in the paper.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Path-guided and target-guided coordination require motion planning techniques for multiple vehicle coordination.

triples.name: Networked control system
triples.relevance: Network-based coordination is identified as a key future research direction for addressing communication bandwidth constraints.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the theoretical foundation for developing coordinated control methods for multiple ASVs.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multiple ASVs constitute a multi-agent system requiring coordination mechanisms for cooperative operations.

triples.name: Optimal control
triples.relevance: Optimization-based coordination is suggested as a future research direction for improving fleet performance.

triples.name: Data-driven control system
triples.relevance: Data-driven coordination of ASVs is identified as an important future investigation direction in the paper.

triples.name: Discrete event dynamic system
triples.relevance: Event-triggered coordination methods represent a control paradigm applicable to ASV fleet coordination.

triples.name: Distributed control system
triples.relevance: Distributed coordination architectures are central to managing multiple autonomous vehicles with limited communication bandwidth.
